Improve this question                    can anyone write pseudocode to compare byte to byte in Java. I understand that we use read() to read byte to byte. but how do we do the comparison? 
Please using this api: InputStream.read.
Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How to compare byte to byte in Java using FileInputStream: :Closed. This question needs to be more focused. It is not currently accepting answers.                                                            Want to improve this question? Update the question so it focuses on one problem only by editing this post.Closed 8 years ago.                        Improve this question                    can anyone write pseudocode to compare byte to byte in Java. I understand that we use read() to read byte to byte. but how do we do the comparison? 
Please using this api: InputStream.read.
Answer: $API
InputStream in = new FileInputStream("file.txt");
int data = in.read();
while (data != -1) {
    if (data != someByte) {
        // do something
    }
    data = in.read();
}
in.close();
$CODE
$EXPLANATION
In this code, we use a FileInputStream to read the file "file.txt". We read the first byte into the variable "data". We then enter a while loop that continues until we have read all bytes in the file. Inside the loop, we compare the byte read with "someByte". If they are not equal, we do something. After that, we read the next byte into "data" and continue the loop. When there are no more bytes to read, read() returns -1, which we check at the beginning of the loop and if it is true, we break the loop. Finally, we close the InputStream to free up resources.
